courses.name: Domain modeling for humans and AI
courses.summary: Learn how to model a domain in TypeScript, and how to collaborate with domain experts and agentic AI coding tools to build a software system that solves real problems.

courses.name: TypeScript Fundamentals v3
courses.summary: Learn everything you need to know in order to confidently and successfully use TypeScript to build a modern JavaScript app.

courses.name: TypeScript Fundamentals v4
courses.summary: Learn everything you need to know in order to confidently and successfully use TypeScript to build a modern JavaScript app.

courses.name: Intermediate TypeScript v1
courses.summary:
Leverage TypeScript's strengths to provide clarity in the face of
complexity, while protecting your codebase and team from it's weaknesses.

courses.name: Intermediate TypeScript v2
courses.summary:
Leverage TypeScript's strengths to provide clarity in the face of
complexity, while protecting your codebase and team from it's weaknesses.

courses.name: Making TypeScript Stick
courses.summary:
Tackle a series of challenges designed to reinforce your knowledge and make
the important concepts truly "stick" in your mind.

courses.name: Enterprise-Scale TypeScript v2
courses.summary:
Learn how to manage large TypeScript code bases with confidence and ease.
In this course, Mike shares his knowledge from years of experience working
with teams who maintain TypeScript projects with hundreds of regular full-time
contributors and 100K+ lines of code.

courses.name: Full Stack TypeScript
courses.summary:
Combine TypeScript and GraphQL's type systems to create full-stack, fully
type-checked code bases that are shockingly easy to refactor and maintain.

markdownRemark.excerpt:
Open server/src/resolvers/Query.ts and replace the fixture array in suggestions() with a call
to the db. And do something similar for currentUser, using the…
markdownRemark.html:
Open server/src/resolvers/Query.ts and replace the fixture array in suggestions() with a call to the db.

ts
  suggestions: (_, __, { db }) => {
    return db.getAllSuggestions();
  },

And do something similar for currentUser, using the first user in the DB as the “current one”

ts
currentUser: (_, __, { db }) => {
  const [firstUser] = db.getAllUsers();
  if (!firstUser)
    throw new Error(
      'currentUser was requested, but there are no users in the database'
    );
  return firstUser;
},

Save everything, and you should now see four suggestions in the UI

Next, let’s deal with nested data in two different situations

frontmatter.title: Data from the database
frontmatter.description: Let's get some data from our database flowing through GraphQL and into the UI
